intro: Echium italicum var. balearicum, commonly known as the Balearic thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to the Balearic Islands. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its visual appeal.
